result.execSummary:
The defendant Jacob A Brown was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Jacob A Brown is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Jacob A Brown was found guilty of Operate with Restricted Controlled Substance (4th w/in 5 yrs), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: any other time being served.

superMiscConds.notes: Same as probation conditions, exception is the condition time.

supervisions.notes: Court ordered Intoxicated Driver Assessment; form filed.

miscConds.notes:
Fine of $600.00, all applicable mandatory surcharges, fees, assessments and costs.   Bail to apply.
If revoked, all financial obligations to be paid through collection of sums by DOC from 25% of funds under Sec.973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended Supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
*Restitution set at zero.
Obtain/maintain full time employment or full time school and part time employment.

Provide a DNA sample if not already provided.  If the same has already been provided, Court will waive the DNA surcharge.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm; also advised that his voting rights are suspended and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
Mental health assessment.  Successfully complete follow up treatment.  Take all medications as prescribed, only in the manner prescribed by a treating physician.
No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.

Cooperate with any and all rules set forth by the probation agent.
Participate in any treatment that is deemed appropriate by the agent.
Complete a cognitive thinking program.

timeConds.notes:
Consecutive to any other sentence.  No good time credit.  Court is opposed to electronic monitoring. 
 During the first half of the condition time, the Court will allow for release to the Day Reporting center for programming and treatment.  During the last half of the condition time, the Court will also allow release for work.
**1/13/2016 Order signed:   release privileges granted for Day Reporting Center.

records.addlTxt:
Order filed.

The defendant's request for release on electronic monitoring is denied as it would unduly depreciate the seriousness of the offense, render the House of Correction time meaningless and frustrate the court's specific sentencing intent.
Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Mark A. Sanders, Br. 28, for review. jbs
Defendant's pro se request for release on electronic monitoring.
Court signed order Granting defendant's request for release privileges to the Day Reporting Center. Copies forwarded to the parties. lr
Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Mark A. Sanders, Br. 28, calendar successor, for review. mag
Defendant's pro se request for release to the DRC for the last four months of the conditional jail term.
Order for Cancellation of Huber/Work Release/Electronic Surveillance Privileges signed and filed.  Copy given to State.

Huber/Work Release Modification Request
.
Request for Huber / Work Release Modification received from HOC and filed this date.  This case is assigned and forwarded to Judge Brash Br 21 for review. os
Denying defendant's motion for release privileges signed and filed.  Copy sent to Defendant and State.
Per Order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this motion/request is hereby assigned to the Hon. William Brash, Br. 21, for review. jbs
Defendant's pro se request for work release.
Order denying defendant's motion or request for additional release privileges signed and filed. c
Per Order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this motion/request is hereby assigned to the Hon. William Brash, Br. 21, for review. mag
Defendant's pro se request for medical release privileges.
Associated with Charge #2

Defendant Jacob A Brown in court with attorney John Thomas Bayer.  Defendant Jacob A Brown in custody.  Jeremy R. Arn appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Negotiations placed on the record.   Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered Count 1 dismissed and Count 3 dismissed and read-in to case for the purposes of sentencing.

As to Count 2:   Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

Defendant Jacob A Brown in court with attorney John Thomas Bayer.  Defendant Jacob A Brown in custody.  Jeremy Arn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Motion is withdrawn.  Matter scheduled for plea and sentencing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Certification of transcript of proceedings of PRELIMINARY HEARING commencing 05/06/2015 received and filed. (19 Pages.)
Copy of transcript forwarded to Atty. John T. Bayer, 230 West Wells Street, Ste 706, Milwaukee, WI, 53203-1866.

Defense counsel notified the court the due to unforeseen circumstances and a family emergency, he would like to moved the motion hearing date of 06/25/2015. State does not object. New date selected: 07/10/2015 at 1:30.

Attorney John Thomas Bayer in court, defendant Jacob A Brown not in court, in custody.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter before the Court for Bail/bond hearing and Scheduling conference.  Hearing proceeded.  Appearance of the defendant waived for the purpose of todays proceedings.    Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.  Defense requests date for motion hearing.  Motion hearing scheduled for June 25, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Motion for Modification of Bail Condition filed by Atty. John T. Bayer.

15RM023386  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
05/06/2015

Defendant Jacob A Brown in court with attorney John Thomas Bayer.  Defendant Jacob A Brown in custody.  Ronald Dague for Jeremy R. Arn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Rayn Solie-West Allis Police Department Officer.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 21.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 21, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for May 21, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER TO WCS  for supervision upon release for the Repeat Intoxicated Driver Program.  
Court orders defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY and to be monitored by drug tests, portable breathalyzers and SCRAM.
No driving without a Valid License.

Defendant Jacob A Brown in court with attorney John Thomas. Bayer.  Defendant Jacob A Brown in custody.  
Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.  
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  
Defendant pleads Not Guilty as to Count 3 ( Misdemeanor).
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT HAS RETAINED PRIVATE COUNSEL  
Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jacob A Brown not in court.   No Assistant District Attorney Available appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Initial appearance scheduled for this date 4-28-2015. Defendant is in custody at HOC. Needs to be produced for court. Both files sent to case prep for OTP by Sheriff's department.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
